task: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Tesla Model 3\LOG\3F78A21D\00000001. Save the concatenated file as Tesla_Model_3_3F78A21D.mf4 in the same folder. GUI instructions: To load all MF4 files:Option 1: Go to File → Open Folder, then enter the path of the desired folder and select it to automatically load all MF4 files within that folder.Option 2: Go to File → Open, then enter the path of the desired folder, select any .MF4 file, press Ctrl + A to highlight all files in the folder, and then press Enter to load them all.

plan.reasoning: Activate the asammdf window so subsequent queries and interactions target the correct application.
Capture the current UI state to discover menus and controls (required before the next click).
Open the Mode menu so we can switch to Batch processing (Batch mode is required for concatenation).
Discover the 'Batch processing' menu item after opening the Mode menu.
Switch application to Batch processing mode which enables concatenation of multiple files.
Capture the Batch processing view to locate the 'Add files' button and other batch controls.
Open the file selection dialog to add multiple .MF4 files for the batch operation.
Inspect the file dialog to find the 'File name' edit where we can type the target folder path.
Focus the 'File name' edit so we can type the folder path to load the desired folder.
Enter the exact folder path (with single backslashes) and press Enter to navigate the file dialog to that folder so all MF4 files become visible.
Refresh UI state after navigating to the folder to discover file entries (individual .MF4 file elements).
Select one visible .MF4 file entry in the folder (using wildcard reference) as the anchor for multi-selection.
Use Ctrl+A to multi-select all .MF4 files in the folder so they will all be added to the batch list.
Confirm the selection in the file dialog to load all selected MF4 files into the Batch processing list.
Capture the Batch processing UI now populated with the selected files so we can choose the operation and set output.
Select the 'Concatenate' operation for the batch so the input files are merged into a single continuous MF4 file.
Discover the output filename edit control after selecting the operation so we can enter the desired output path and name.
Focus the output filename edit so we can type the full output file path and name.
Enter the full output path and filename (single backslashes) to save the concatenated MF4 in the same folder with the requested name.
Confirm the output filename is set and discover the 'Start' (or 'Save') button to begin the concatenation.
Start the batch concatenation process which will create the single output MF4 file from all selected inputs.
Verify the process has started/completed and that the new file appears or the batch finished state is shown.

Switch to Batch processing mode, use the Add files dialog to navigate to the specified folder and multi-select all .MF4 files, choose the Concatenate operation, enter the exact output path/filename in the batch output field, and start the batch job. The sequence alternates state captures with interactions to reliably discover UI elements before each action and to ensure the correct controls (Add files, File name edit, file entries, operation selection, output edit, Start) are targeted.
